For now, clearing .metadata/.plugins and rebuilding projects eliminated the problem for me.
Re: Commnent #3, the same worked for me for a while, but then the problem came back again.

After further experience, the error seems to happen when I had left Eclipse with "many" files option (perhaps around more than 20 - 30 files.)  Closing all open files and reopening eclipse works around the problem.

(In reply to comment #5)
> After further experience, the error seems to happen when I had left Eclipse
> with "many" files option (perhaps around more than 20 - 30 files.)  Closing all
> open files and reopening eclipse works around the problem.
> 

This worked for me too, however the problem only arose when I disabled the Examples plugin and restarted the workbench (Kubuntu, Dapper) in an effort to remove the annoying little green bar at the bottom of the IDE that says "Read Me Trim (Bottom)."  Lesson learned:  never disable plugins in Eclipse, ever.  :-)

As part of some general bugzilla cleanup, I am marking all old JEM bugs as "won't fix" simply because JEM is in maintenance mode, and there are no plans to fix these old bugs. 

If I have mistaken marked something that is still a current problem in the latests releases from WTP, please re-open.
Moving back to VE. Despite this being a WTP bug, the EMF part may affect VE too.
